comments:
Just doing general work with SWT in the source editor, moving components by
reordering the contructor statements.  After moving one the editor becomes
unresponsive.  Eventually an error dialog like the one shown in the attachment
comes up, notifiying of an SWT error.  All of the Windows handles have been
used, the workbench needs to be killed and Windows acts funky for a while
(thankfully did not require a reboot).

In the .log had several copies of this ControlManagaer error until the one at
the bottom showing that all the OS handles were used:

Created an attachment (id=9848)
Error dialog with SWT error

Note: colors are messed up, because Windows didn't have the resource handles to
devote to the colors in the screen capturing process.

Jeff,
I can't re-create this, but I did look at the target VM and how it allocates 
and frees resources.  There was a bug with image grabbing where an image was 
created for each control and each child control and they get combined via a 
gc.drawImage(...) into the final result.   The child controls' images were not 
being disposed so I fixed this.  Hopefully this will mean you won't get the 
problem again so please catch up and try to break it again - JRW

Jeff,

    If you can not recreate this anymore, please close this.  If it is hard to
recreate, please work with Joe on this, and reduce the severity.

I can't recreate this problem anymore.  Will close this bug, and reopen if it
pops up again.
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
